div.ab: zōt ud rāspīg: Geldner, Kotwal and Boyd.
zōt ud rāspīg hāuuanīm ... ahi, zōt [miϑrō ziiāt̰ ...]: Anklesaria, 1888, p. 48.

Commentary.ab: Y9.1c ā.dīm] likely for āat̰. īm.
Y9.1c kō narə ahi] add. post. glossa miϑrō ziiāt̰ zaraϑuštrəm 100 (sec. manu), 110 (sec. manu), 231, 235, 672, 677. Kellens [miϑrō ziiāt̰ zaraϑuštrəm]. Vid. Modern Practice.

Y9.1d xᵛanuuatō aməṣ̌ahe] add. post. glossa amaraba saiiehe stūn 672, 677; amərəza gaiiehe stūna 400, 410, 500, 510; amərəzagaiiie stūna 235; amairazaγaiiahi stūnē 231. Kellens [amərəza gaiiehe stūna]; Unvala, 1924, p.6 also includes the text. Pirart, 2004, p.59, n.16 cf. Yt10.71 mərəzuca stūnō gaiiehe.

RecitationInstruction.ab: hāuuanīm ā ratūm ...] hāuuanīm ā ratūm OD LOYŠE višapą̇m iδa patəṇtu (Y10.1) 40.

xᵛahe gaiiehe xᵛanuuatō aməṣ̌ahe = Yt8.11, Yt10.55.

Quotations.ab: Dādweh guft hād nar [ka wars] pad parāhōm kard estēd, ēw-tom [[hān ī xūbtar]] az rāspīg ī abēgumān wāz frāz gīrēd. Ēk pad abestāg frōd kunēnd ud zōt hōm-stūt bun abāz kunēd, pad hōm-stūt bun be nigērišn. Pad nəmō haōmāi mazdaδātāi vaŋhuš haōmā huδātō be nigērišn. Pas ka nihuft estēd weh-iz ast.

"Dādweh said: 'When the priest has applied the waras to the parāhōm the foremost priest [[i.e. the best]] takes the bāj from a well-qualified rāspī (= Y9.0). They set down one with (recitation of) Avestan, and the zōt starts (reciting) the Hōm Stūt from the beginning (= Y9.1); at the beginning of the Hōm Stūt he should gaze at it. At nəmō haomāi mazdaδātāi vaŋhuš haomō huδātō he should gaze at it (again). After this it is indeed better if it is hidden."

Kotwal and Kreyenbroek, 2003, p.97, n. 333 "Probably Y9.16; although extant versions of the text do not contain the word mazdaδātāi". More likely Y11.8 (= VrS11.8) before the installation of the priests (VrS11.9), mentioned just afterwards in N28.41, but the text does not contain huδātō, but mazdaδātō.

ModernPractice.ab: "It must be noted that the expr. miϑrō zyāṯ zaraϑuštrəm [...] is never left out in the recitation of Y. IX during ceremonies".
